results.title: Yugoslavia; Hungary
results.creator_credit: William Fitzwater, Fitzwater Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Depicts the experiences of Australian children of various ethnic backgrounds in the country where their parents were born. “Yugoslavia”: Duska Franic discovers her large extended family when visiting her parents’ birthplace in the beautiful Croatian countryside. “Hungary”: Debbie Karp journeys to Budapest, her mother’s birthplace. She visits relatives and tours Hungary on a voyage of discovery.

results.title: Rosemary Agostino in Italy; Angela Sarantis in Greece
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Barinder Productions and Channel 0-28
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Two programs from the series :Through Australian eyes”. In the first program Rosemary Agostino returns to her parents’ birthplace in Calabria. In the small village she becomes aware of the sense of community missing from life in Australia. In the second program Angela Sarantis returns to her father’s village in Kastraki in northern Greece. She sees that many changes have occurred since her parents left their homeland particularly due to the demands of Greece’s main industry, tourism.

results.title: Thomas and the jet engine
results.creator_credit: David Mitton, Britt Allcroft and Britt Allcroft Co
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Thomas the tank engine & friends”.
It’s full steam ahead for Thomas, the little blue engine and his special friends Gordon, Henry, James, Percy, Edward, Toby, Annie and Clarabel and their boss, the Fat Controller. The stories are narrated by Michael Angelis.

results.title: Thomas the Tank Engine; Thomas and Gordon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Mitton, Britt Allcroft and Britt Allcroft Co
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Thomas the tank engine & friends”.
It’s full steam ahead for Thomas, the little blue engine with the short, stumpy funnel, short, stumpy boiler and short, stumpy dome and his special friends Gordon, Henry, James, Percy, Edward, Toby and Annie and Clarabel the carriages, and of course their boss, the Fat Controller. His friend, stroyteller Ringo Starr, says “Thomas is number one and never lets anyone forget it!” Based on The Railway Series by Rev W. Awdry.

results.title: [Return to Michigan]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
In 1976, tragedy struck the farmers at Michigan. A poisonous chemical, PBB, had been mixed into stock food, and all livestock had to be killed and the contamination was passed on through foods for human consumption causing much illness.

results.title: Material unaccounted for
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
Investigates the security of the nuclear plant at which Karen Silkwood worked before her mysterious death. Radioactive material had been placed in Ms. Silkwood’s home during the period in which she was campaigning against the working conditions and safety measures at the U.S. American plant.
